description.p: Green Wardens are well-attuned to the primal energies of nature and, through the study of animals, they can manipulate this energy to allow them to transform parts of their bodies into a more animalistic form. In the deepest reaches of the forest, a Green Warden can be found, maintaining the natural order and protecting the wilderness from threats of all kinds. Other Green Wardens are protectors of druid groves, perfecting their skill and knowledge of nature.

description.p: You learn an additional spell when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the Green Warden Spells table. Each spell counts as a ranger spell for you, but it doesn’t count against the number of ranger spells you know.

You are able to transform parts of your body into the equivalent part of an animal, enhancing your abilities with that animal’s ability for a short while. You learn three armaments of your choice, which are listed under “Armaments” below. You learn two additional armaments at 7th and 11th level. Each time you learn a new armament, you can also replace one armament you know with a different one.

As a bonus action, you may manifest one of the armaments you know. Each transformation lasts for a duration described in that armament, until you use this feature again, or until you end it early on your turn (no action required).
You may use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining all expended uses whenever you complete a short or long rest.

sheet.description: You may manifest one of the armaments you know. Each transformation lasts for a duration described in that armament, until you use this feature again, or until you end it early on your turn (no action required).

description.p: The damage from your armaments counts as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

Additionally, you can use your bonus action to manifest a second armament, even if you already have one active at the time. When you try to manifest a third armament this way, you choose which of the two you have active to replace with the new armament.

description.p: You know summon beast. It doesn’t count against the number of ranger spells you know, and you can cast it without a material component. You can also cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.

Whenever you cast summon beast, the beast’s attacks count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage. Additionally, you may expend a use of your Nature’s Armaments feature to imbue the beast with an armament you know as a part of casting the spell. The beast gains the benefits of the armament as if it had manifested the armament itself, except the armament’s duration lasts until the spell ends.

description.p: For 1 minute, one or both of your arms become furred and muscular, with the great claws of a bear. When you make a melee weapon attack using Strength, your attack deals an extra 1d4 damage on a hit. Additionally, your claws are natural weapons, which counts as a simple melee weapon for you. They deal 2d6 slashing damage.
When you reach 11th level, your claws count as light weapons.

description.p: For 1 minute, you are able to change the color of your skin to better blend into your surroundings. You have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks and you can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by natural phenomena.
Additionally, when you are hidden from a creature and hit it with a weapon attack, you deal an extra 1d8 damage to that creature.

description.p: For 1 hour, you grow gills and fins, granting you the ability to breathe underwater and you gain a swimming speed equal to twice your walking speed.

description.p: For 10 minutes, your legs bow and bend like a jumping insect. Your jump distance is tripled and when you make a standing long jump or a standing high jump, you jump the full distance, rather than only half.

description.p: For 1 minute, your skin becomes hard and scaly like a crocodile, granting you a +2 bonus to AC. This bonus increases by an additional +1 at 11th level.

description.p: For 1 hour, your sense of smell heightens to the strength of a hunting hound. You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks based on smell and can use your smell in place of Wisdom (Survival) checks made to track a creature.

description.p: For 1 minute, a part of your body becomes as flexible as a snake, allowing you to constrict your enemies. You have advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks made to grapple a creature. Additionally, whenever you successfully grapple a creature, you may constrict that creature, dealing bludgeoning damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier to it. When you take the Attack action on subsequent turns, if you are still grappling that creature, you can make an unarmed strike against it (no action required). On a hit, the attack deals bludgeoning damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier, in place of the normal damage of your unarmed strike.
